metadata.description:
This data set contains meteorological element observation data from January 1, 2014 to December 31, 2014 at the aruyinpo station, upstream of heihe hydrometeorological observation network.The station is located in the south of ahrou township, qilian county, qinghai province.The longitude and latitude of the observation point are 100.4108E, 37.9841N and 3536m above sea level.The air temperature and relative humidity sensors are located at 5m, facing due north.The barometer is installed in the anti-skid box on the ground;The tilting bucket rain gauge is installed at 10m;The wind speed and direction sensor is set at 10m, facing due north;The four-component radiometer is installed at 6m, facing due south;Two infrared surface thermometers were installed at 6m, facing due south, and the probe facing vertically downward;Two photosynthetically active radiators were installed at 6m, facing due south, and one probe was vertically upward and downward.The soil temperature probe is buried at 0cm on the surface and 4cm underground, 10cm, 20cm, 40cm, 80cm, 120cm, 160cm, 2m to the south of the meteorological tower.The soil water probe is buried at 4cm, 10cm, 20cm, 40cm, 80cm, 120cm and 160cm underground, 2m to the south of the meteorological tower.The soil heat flow plates (3 pieces) are buried in the ground 6cm underground, 2m to the south of the meteorological tower.
Observation projects are: air temperature and humidity (Ta_5m, RH_5m) (unit: c, percentage), pressure (Press) (unit: hundred mpa), precipitation (Rain) (unit: mm), wind speed (WS_10m) (unit: m/s), wind (WD_10m) (unit: degrees), the radiation of four component (DR, UR, DLR_Cor, ULR_Cor, Rn) (unit: watts per square meter), the surface radiation temperature (IRT_1, IRT_2) (unit:(unit: Ts_0cm, Ts_4cm, Ts_10cm, Ts_20cm, Ts_40cm, Ts_80cm, Ts_120cm, Ts_160cm) (unit: Celsius), soil moisture (Ms_4cm, Ms_10cm, Ms_20cm, Ms_40cm, Ms_80cm, Ms_120cm, Ms_160cm) (unit:Volumetric water content, percentage), upward and downward photosynthetically active radiation (PAR_up, PAR_down) (in micromol/m2 seconds).
Processing and quality control of observed data :(1) ensure 144 pieces of data every day (every 10min), and mark by -6999 in case of data missing;The air temperature was between June 24, 2014 to June 28, 2014 and July 7, 2014 to August 24, 2014.Surface radiation temperature was between June 24, 2014 and July 4, 2014. Due to sensor problems, data was missing.The soil temperature was between June 24, 2014 and July 1, 2014. Due to the problem of the extension board of collector, data was missing.Due to problems in the power supply system, data was missing between December 3, 2014 and December 31, 2014.(2) excluding the time with duplicate records;(3) data that obviously exceeds the physical significance or the range of the instrument is deleted;(4) the part marked with red letter in the data is the data in question;(5) date and time have the same format, and date and time are in the same column.For example, the time is: September 10, 2014, 10:30;(6) the naming rule is: AWS+ site name.
For information of hydrometeorological network or station, please refer to Liu et al.(2018), and for observation data processing, please refer to Liu et al.(2011).
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2014年1月1日至2014年12月31日黑河水文气象观测网上游阿柔阴坡站气象要素观测数据。站点位于青海省祁连县阿柔乡南侧阴坡，下垫面是高寒草地。观测点的经纬度是100.4108E, 37.9841N，海拔3536m。空气温度、相对湿度传感器架设在5m处，朝向正北；气压计安装在地面上的防撬箱内；翻斗式雨量计安装在10m处；风速与风向传感器架设在10m，朝向正北；四分量辐射仪安装在6m处，朝向正南；两个红外地表温度计安装在6m处，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；两个光合有效辐射仪安装在6m处，朝向正南，探头垂直向上向下方向各一个；土壤温度探头埋设在地表0cm和地下4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、80cm、120cm、160cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤水分探头埋设在地下4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、80cm、120cm、160cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤热流板（3块）依次埋设在地下6cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方。
观测项目有：空气温湿度（Ta_5m、RH_5m）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、气压（Press）(单位：百帕)、降水量（Rain）(单位：毫米)、风速（WS_10m）(单位：米/秒)、风向（WD_10m）(单位：度)、四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor、Rn）(单位：瓦/平方米)、地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_4cm、Ts_10cm、Ts_20cm、Ts_40cm、Ts_80cm、Ts_120cm、Ts_160cm）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤水分（Ms_4cm、Ms_10cm、Ms_20cm、Ms_40cm、Ms_80cm、Ms_120cm、Ms_160cm）(单位：体积含水量，百分比)、向上与向下光合有效辐射（PAR_up、PAR_down）(单位：微摩尔/平方米秒)。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保每天144个数据（每10min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；空气温度在2014.6.24-6.28和2014.7.1-8.24之间由于传感器的问题，数据缺失；地表辐射温度在2014.6.24-7.4之间由于传感器的问题，数据缺失；土壤温度在2014.6.24-7.1之间由于采集器扩展板的问题，数据缺失；由于供电系统出现问题，在2014.12.3-12.31之间数据缺失；（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2014-9-10 10:30；（6）命名规则为：AWS+站点名称。
水文气象网或站点信息请参考Liu et al. (2018)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al.(2011)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被的混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“冠层上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况。水蒸气和热量在冠层内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过冠层顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型较为复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射仪视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量值来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已被广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层）与使用波恩比-能量平衡系统、涡度协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果的比较。

在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，尤其是在涡度协方差（EC）通量测量的潜热（LE）和感热（H）与可用能量（Rn−G0）之间存在能量平衡闭合不完全的情况下。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面与空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这种温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。本文指出，与观测到的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计的情况。这往往对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强对流环境也是一个重要因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散发（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，得到了E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的观察比率。
这封信的目的是利用通过高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，估算蒸散（E）、土壤温度（T）和蒸散总量（ET），并随后结合稳定氧和氢同位素技术以及涡度相关（EC）测量，更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

衍生组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的；这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还由于EC系统的不确定性增加，当灌溉农田的平均H较小时，这种不确定性为18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被计算为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度被高估。另一方面，忽略大气上行辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括离地5米处的空气温度、风速、湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及使用采样频率为10 Hz的涡度相关系统在离地4.5米处测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔上25米高的平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天的07:00至19:00之间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的感热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）计算得出。土壤和冠层的组件温度是通过热像仪获取的图像计算得出的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮温。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率，将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区域是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）以及蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）相对于ET的比率，这些研究是在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中进行的，属于黑河水联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠的结果，与EC系统的测量值相比，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估计的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值很好地一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估计也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: The alpine region is important in riverine and watershed ecosystems as a contributor of freshwater, providing and stimulating specific habitats for biodiversity. In parallel, recent climate change, human activities, and other perturbations may disturb hydrological processes and eco-functions, creating the need for next-generation observational and modeling approaches to advance a predictive understanding of such processes in the alpine region. Water resources in the alpine region are headwaters that need to be regulated to sustain downstream ecosystems. However, perturbations induced by nature/climate change and human activities in recent years have significantly reformed hydrological processes and eco-functions. Accurate estimation and prediction of hydrological processes and their key impact factors has since become crucial.

Unfortunately, the scarcity of observation data in the alpine region, due to the difficulties of access and technological barriers, has hindered alpine hydrological modeling and associated research yet motivated the development of next-generation ecosystem observation networks and experiments. In comparison with the observations, using remote sensing data combined with data assimilation could improve the prediction of hydrological processes. However, due to the complexities of the earth system, there exist various sources of uncertainties in remote sensing data (especially in the alpine region), which have to be validated and calibrated. In summary, to fill the knowledge gap and promote alpine region hydrology research, an integrated, distributed and multiscale observation dataset is essential and expected to provide accurate forcing data for hydrological modeling, validate remote sensing data, allow the evaluation of distributed models and ultimately improve a predictive understanding of alpine hydrological processes and ecosystem functions. In alpine hydrology, in addition to consistent hydrometeorological data obtained from distributed meteorological stations, snow cover and frozen ground are two important indexes and driving forces that manipulate hydrological processes. The maximum snow water equivalent (SWE) before ablation determines the storage of snowmelt – a major source of freshwater in the alpine region, while freeze-thaw cycles (FTCs) and soil moisture within the active layer alter water infiltration and, consequently, surface runoff and groundwater. To promote alpine hydrology research, the International Network for Alpine Research Catchment Hydrology (INARCH) was launched in 2015 by the Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) project of the World Climate Research Programme (WCRP), involving 18 catchments around the world. The INARCH has since connected individual observatories into an international network and data-share platform to lead frontier research on alpine region hydrometeorology and snow observation. Another community-based observation network, the Circumpolar Active Layer Monitoring (CALM) network, was initiated in the early 1990s to observe the response of the active layer and near-surface permafrost to climate change. The Heihe River Basin (HRB) is the second largest inland river basin in China and is known for its heterogeneous landscapes, diverse ecosystems, unique geographical characteristics and climate change over recent decades. As a major component of the ecohydrological processes in the arid/semi-arid HRB, the alpine hydrological processes, especially those related to snow cover and frozen ground in the upper reaches, have great impacts on runoff in the mountainous region, which then regulate agricultural development in the middle reaches and the ecosystems of the lower reaches.

In recent years, with climate warming, permafrost degradation has significantly affected runoff and the carbon cycle (Peng et al., 2016; Gao et al., 2018). Snow cover is widely distributed with unique characteristics in the study area. In the high-altitude mountainous region (elevation > 3800 m), influenced by the local microclimate and low temperature, snowfall could occur in any season. Temporary snow is the major snow cover type in the region at middle and low elevations because strong solar radiation and high air temperature lead to fast melting and sublimation of the snow. Drifting snow is also commonly observed in the region, which may lead to the redistribution of snowpack in high elevation regions (Essery et al., 1999; Li et al., 2014).

Blowing (drifting) snow is commonly observed in the Qilian mountain due to its high altitude and complex terrain. It is important to estimate the occurrence of blowing snow because it may cause redistributions of the snow cover and influence the sublimation of snow.

Soil heat conductivity is difficult to analyze because it is a function of soil density, soil moisture content (ice content in frozen ground), and soil temperature, which cannot be easily calculated using a simple formula. Therefore, site observations can be utilized to evaluate the parameterization of alpine hydrologic models.

Considering the characteristics of the study site, an integrated, distributed and multiscale hydrometeorological – snow – frozen ground observation network has been established with seven automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) and two superstations. At the basin scale, the observation aims to collect data for investigating the meteorological driving forces and for validation of the alpine hydrological models. At the sub-basin scale, small-scale observations and measurements focus on data such as precipitation, soil temperature and moisture, which are used to develop and improve hydrologic models, as well as to validate remote sensing products at medium to coarse resolutions (Jin et al., 2014). At the two superstations for snow cover and frozen ground observations, remote sensing products can be further validated using fine-resolution data. In total, seven AMSs, as well as the frozen ground and snow superstations (also incorporating meteorological observations), were established in the study area during the intensive observation period (IOP: 2013 -2014) to obtain the spatially distributed meteorological variables. After the IOP, four typical AMSs were selected and retained for continuous observation, which is expected to provide long-term datasets. The observed meteorological variables include wind (speed and direction), air temperature, humidity, infrared temperature, air pressure, four-component radiation, and precipitation. Accumulation and depletion processes were measured automatically at the Yakou snow superstation. The observed components included snow depth, snow water equivalent (SWE, measured by GammaMONitor, GMON), albedo of the snow surface and blowing (drifting) snow flux (measured by FlowCapt). Soil temperature and moisture were measured within six layers at each AMS, while evapotranspiration (ET) was observed by eddy covariance (EC) at three AMSs located in permafrost, seasonally frozen ground and a transient zone to observe freeze-thaw (FT) processes. At the sub-basin scale, a wireless sensor network (WSN) with 40 nodes was established to capture seasonal changes in soil temperature and moisture. At the A’rou frozen ground superstation, soil temperature and moisture profiles were intensively measured in eighteen layers to a depth of 3.2 m (in a nested pattern with more layers in the topsoil) to obtain the soil hydrothermal features under freeze-thaw cycles (FTCs). In addition, thermal conductivity and hydraulic conductivity in the topsoil were also measured to observe the dynamic hydrothermal processes within.

Snow depth was measured by SR50A (Campbell, USA), which determines the distance between the sensor and the target by sending out ultrasonic pulses and listening for the returning echoes reflected from the target. Snow water equivalent (SWE) was measured by GMON (CS725 GammaMONitor, Campbell, USA) from 2014/1/1 to 2017/12/31 at a temporal resolution of 6 hr. FlowCapt (IAV, Switzerland) was used to measure the number of blowing snow grains at 3 heights (0-1 m, 1-2 m, and 2-3 m) every 10 mins.

In this paper, a suite of alpine hydrology datasets observed from an integrated, distributed and multiscale hydrometeorological – snow – frozen ground observation network in the upper reaches of the Heihe River Basin (HRB) is presented.
backgroundCn: 阿尔卑斯地区在河流和流域生态系统中具有重要意义，作为淡水的来源，提供并刺激特定栖息地的生物多样性。与此同时，近年来气候变化、人类活动和其他扰动可能会干扰水文过程和生态功能，这就需要下一代观测和建模方法来推进对阿尔卑斯地区这些过程的预测理解。阿尔卑斯地区的水资源是需要调节的源头水，以维持下游生态系统。然而，近年来自然/气候变化和人类活动引发的扰动显著改变了水文过程和生态功能。因此，准确估计和预测水文过程及其关键影响因素变得至关重要。

不幸的是，由于高山地区观测数据的稀缺，主要是由于获取困难和技术障碍，阻碍了高山水文建模及相关研究，但也促使了下一代生态系统观测网络和实验的发展。与观测数据相比，结合数据同化的遥感数据可以改善水文过程的预测。然而，由于地球系统的复杂性，遥感数据（尤其是在高山地区）存在各种不确定性来源，这些都需要进行验证和校准。总之，为了填补知识空白并促进高山地区水文研究，集成的、分布式的和多尺度的观测数据集是必不可少的，预计将为水文建模提供准确的强迫数据，验证遥感数据，评估分布式模型，并最终改善对高山水文过程和生态系统功能的预测理解。在高山水文学中，除了从分布式气象站获得的一致的水文气象数据外，雪盖和冻土是两个重要的指标和驱动因素，影响水文过程。融化前的最大雪水当量（SWE）决定了雪融水的储存——这是高山地区淡水的主要来源，而冻融循环（FTC）和活层内的土壤水分则改变了水的渗透，进而影响地表径流和地下水。为了促进高山水文研究，国际高山研究流域水文网络（INARCH）于2015年由世界气候研究计划（WCRP）的全球能量与水交换（GEWEX）项目发起，涉及全球18个流域。自那时以来，INARCH将各个观测站连接成一个国际网络和数据共享平台，以引领高山地区水文气象和雪观测的前沿研究。另一个基于社区的观测网络，极圈活层监测（CALM）网络，始于1990年代初，旨在观察活层和近地表永久冻土对气候变化的响应。黑河流域（HRB）是中国第二大内陆河流域，以其异质的景观、多样的生态系统、独特的地理特征和近年来的气候变化而闻名。作为干旱/半干旱HRB生态水文过程的主要组成部分，高山水文过程，特别是与上游雪盖和冻土相关的过程，对山区的径流产生重大影响，进而调节中游的农业发展和下游的生态系统。

近年来，随着气候变暖，永冻土退化显著影响了径流和碳循环（Peng et al., 2016; Gao et al., 2018）。研究区域内雪盖分布广泛，具有独特的特征。在高海拔山区（海拔 > 3800 米），受当地微气候和低温的影响，任何季节都有可能出现降雪。临时雪是该地区中低海拔地区的主要雪盖类型，因为强烈的太阳辐射和高气温导致雪的快速融化和升华。漂移雪在该地区也常见，这可能导致高海拔地区雪层的重新分布（Essery et al., 1999; Li et al., 2014）。
由于祁连山的高海拔和复杂地形，常常观察到吹雪（漂移雪）。估计吹雪的发生是重要的，因为它可能导致雪盖的重新分布，并影响雪的升华。
土壤热导率的分析比较困难，因为它是土壤密度、土壤水分含量（在冻土中为冰含量）和土壤温度的函数，这些因素无法通过简单的公式轻易计算。因此，可以利用现场观测来评估高山水文模型的参数化。
research objectiveCn: 本研究提供了一套数据集，包括长期的水文气象、雪盖和冻土数据，用于从一个综合的、分布式的和多尺度的观测网络中研究中国黑河流域上游的流域科学和功能。
本文介绍了HRB地区综合阿尔卑斯水文观测网络的基础设施以及近年来收集的完整数据集。
相关的开放获取数据集包括高质量的水文气象数据，特别是针对子流域和流域尺度的雪和冻土观测，旨在解决多种科学问题，包括但不限于：（1）如何为高山水文模型提供准确有效的强迫数据，（2）如何整合观测、模拟和获取的数据集以获得有意义的理解，以及（3）扰动（气候变化和人类活动）如何改变基本过程。
challengesCn: 然而，寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔以及复杂的地形等几项严峻挑战，妨碍了在需要的地方和时间进行全面和一致的数据收集，这阻碍了遥感技术和高山水文模型的发展。
不幸的是，由于获取数据的困难和技术障碍，阿尔卑斯地区观测数据的稀缺阻碍了阿尔卑斯水文模型及相关研究的发展，但也促使了下一代生态观测网络和实验的开发。然而，上述建模工作面临着以下问题：1）强迫数据的可用性（只有中国气象局在HRB上游运营的两个气象站正常工作）；2）缺乏高质量的雪和冻土数据用于参数化。
不幸的是，由于强风的影响，这项工作并不顺利。因此，目前无法获得可以通过雪深和雪水当量（SWE）数据计算的雪密度数据。
methodsCn: 无间断的气象和水文数据通过连接一组自动气象站（AMS）的观测网络进行监测。此外，为了捕捉雪的积累和融化过程，使用先进的技术和仪器从一个雪观测超级站收集了雪盖特性。高分辨率的土壤物理数据集也从一个冻土观测超级站获得，以捕捉冻融过程。

考虑到研究地点的特征，建立了一个综合的、分布式的多尺度水文气象-雪-冻土观测网络，包含七个自动气象站（AMS）和两个超级站。在流域尺度上，观测旨在收集数据，以研究气象驱动因素并验证阿尔卑斯水文模型。在子流域尺度上，小规模的观测和测量集中在降水、土壤温度和湿度等数据上，这些数据用于开发和改进水文模型，以及验证中等到粗分辨率的遥感产品（Jin et al., 2014）。在两个雪盖和冻土观测的超级站中，可以利用高分辨率数据进一步验证遥感产品。在密集观测期（IOP：2013-2014）期间，在研究区域建立了七个AMS以及冻土和雪超级站（也包含气象观测），以获取空间分布的气象变量。在IOP之后，选择并保留了四个典型的AMS进行持续观测，预计将提供长期数据集。观测的气象变量包括风速和风向、气温、湿度、红外温度、气压、四分量辐射和降水。雅口雪超级站自动测量积累和消耗过程，观测的组成部分包括雪深、雪水当量（SWE，由GammaMONitor测量）、雪面反照率和风吹（飘雪）通量（由FlowCapt测量）。在每个AMS内，土壤温度和湿度在六个层次上进行测量，而蒸散发（ET）则在位于永久冻土、季节性冻土和过渡区的三个AMS上通过涡度协方差（EC）进行观测，以观察冻融（FT）过程。在子流域尺度上，建立了一个包含40个节点的无线传感器网络（WSN），以捕捉土壤温度和湿度的季节变化。在A’rou冻土超级站，土壤温度和湿度剖面在十八个层次上进行密集测量，深度达到3.2米（采用嵌套模式，表层有更多层次），以获取冻融循环（FTC）下的土壤水热特征。此外，还测量了表层土壤的热导率和水力导率，以观察动态水热过程。

雪深通过SR50A（美国Campbell）进行测量，该设备通过发出超声波脉冲并监听从目标反射回来的回声来确定传感器与目标之间的距离。雪水当量（SWE）通过GMON（CS725 GammaMONitor，美国Campbell）在2014年1月1日至2017年12月31日期间以6小时的时间分辨率进行测量。FlowCapt（瑞士IAV）用于测量在3个高度（0-1米、1-2米和2-3米）每10分钟的吹雪颗粒数量。
datasetCn: 本研究提供了一套数据集，包括长期的水文气象、雪盖和冻土数据，用于从综合、分布式和多尺度观测网络研究中国黑河流域上游的流域科学和功能。通过连接一组自动气象站（AMS）的观测网络，监测到了无间隙的气象和水文数据。此外，为了捕捉雪的积累和融化过程，使用先进的技术和仪器从雪观测超级站收集了雪盖特性数据。还从冻土观测超级站获取了高分辨率的土壤物理数据集，以捕捉冻融过程。这些更新的数据集已向具有多学科背景（如冰冻圈科学、水文学和气象学）的科学家发布，预计将作为测试平台，为更广泛的社区提供准确的强迫数据，并验证和评估遥感产品和水文模型。
本文介绍了HRB地区综合阿尔卑斯水文观测网络的基础设施及近年来收集的完整数据集。该观测网络由七个标准水文气象站、一个雪超级站和一个冻土超级站组成，作为一个综合研究平台，旨在提供HRB上游水文气象过程的显著数据集（如水文气象、雪和冻土），预计将支持阿尔卑斯地区水文模型的开发和模拟以及遥感观测。
来自Yakou雪超级站的综合雪数据集自2013年夏季以来已更新。观察到的雪变量包括雪深、雪水当量（SWE）和吹雪（漂雪）。2014年1月1日至2017年12月31日的数据在图4中进行了总结，并附有降水、蒸散发、土壤温度和湿度的额外图表。数据集的可用时间为2012年12月5日至2017年12月31日，间歇性丢失主要是由于高海拔地区的电力损失和传感器故障。
在本文中，展示了一套来自于黑河上游集成的、分布式的多尺度水文气象-雪-冻土观测网络的阿尔卑斯水文数据集。

Definition.QuestionEn: How is 'energy balance closure' relevant in the context of evapotranspiration estimation models?
Definition.QuestionCn: “能量平衡闭合”在蒸散发估算模型的背景下是如何相关的？
Definition.AnswerEn: Energy balance closure is crucial in evapotranspiration estimation models as it ensures that all energy inputs and outputs in a system are accounted for. In the context of models like the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model, achieving energy balance closure is essential for accurately estimating surface fluxes. Incomplete energy balance closure, particularly in strongly advective agricultural areas, can lead to errors in estimating latent and sensible heat fluxes, affecting the overall accuracy of evapotranspiration measurements.
Definition.AnswerCn: 能量平衡闭合在蒸散发估算模型中至关重要，因为它确保系统中所有能量输入和输出都被考虑在内。在像双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型的背景下，实现能量平衡闭合对于准确估算表面通量是必不可少的。在强烈的平流农业区域，能量平衡闭合不完全可能导致潜热和显热通量估算的错误，从而影响蒸散发测量的整体准确性。

Definition.QuestionEn: What are 'freeze-thaw cycles' and their significance in alpine hydrology?
Definition.QuestionCn: “冻融循环”是指在寒冷气候条件下，水分在冻结和融化之间反复循环的过程。这种现象在高山水文学中具有重要意义，因为它影响了水的可用性、土壤稳定性和生态系统的健康。冻融循环可以导致土壤侵蚀、岩石风化和水文过程的变化，从而影响水资源的管理和生态平衡。
Definition.AnswerEn: Freeze-thaw cycles refer to the periodic freezing and thawing of the soil surface and subsurface layers, significantly impacting hydrological processes in alpine regions. These cycles alter soil moisture and water infiltration rates, influencing surface runoff and groundwater dynamics. Understanding freeze-thaw cycles is important for modeling hydrological processes and predicting their impacts on ecosystems, especially in regions with permafrost and seasonally frozen ground.
Definition.AnswerCn: 冻融循环是指土壤表层和地下层的周期性冻结和解冻，这对高山地区的水文过程产生显著影响。这些循环改变了土壤湿度和水分渗透率，影响地表径流和地下水动态。理解冻融循环对于建模水文过程和预测其对生态系统的影响非常重要，尤其是在有永冻土和季节性冻土的地区。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What underlying factors might contribute to the challenges in obtaining complete and consistent data collection in high-altitude and complex topography regions?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 在高海拔和复杂地形地区，获取完整和一致的数据收集面临的挑战可能由以下潜在因素造成：
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The challenges in obtaining complete and consistent data collection in high-altitude and complex topography regions may be attributed to the cold and harsh climate, high altitude, and complex terrain, which inhibit data collection where and when needed. These conditions hinder the development of remote sensing technologies and alpine hydrological models, and the scarcity of observation data due to difficulties in access and technological barriers further complicates the situation.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 在高海拔和复杂地形地区，获取完整和一致的数据收集面临的挑战可归因于寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形，这些因素阻碍了在需要时和需要的地方进行数据收集。这些条件妨碍了遥感技术和高山水文模型的发展，而由于获取困难和技术障碍导致的观测数据稀缺进一步加剧了这一情况。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What methodologies could be employed to effectively capture and validate data in heterogeneous landscapes with mixed soil and vegetation components?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 在具有混合土壤和植被成分的异质景观中，有哪些方法可以有效捕获和验证数据？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Methodologies that could be employed include using a two-source energy balance (TSEB) model to estimate evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration by separating soil and canopy component temperatures, which can be observed via high-resolution thermal cameras. Additionally, integrating ground-based measurements, such as eddy covariance systems and isotope techniques, can improve the validation of the estimated data, especially in heterogeneous landscapes where soil and vegetation components exhibit different temperatures and resistances to energy exchange.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 可以采用的方法包括使用双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型来估算蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散，通过高分辨率热像仪观察土壤和冠层组件的温度。此外，结合地面测量，如涡度协方差系统和同位素技术，可以提高估算数据的验证，特别是在土壤和植被组件表现出不同温度和能量交换阻力的异质景观中。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How could the integration of remote sensing data improve the understanding and prediction of hydrological processes in alpine regions?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 遥感数据的整合如何提高对高山地区水文过程的理解和预测？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The integration of remote sensing data, combined with data assimilation, could improve the prediction of hydrological processes by providing accurate forcing data for alpine hydrological models, validating remote sensing data, and evaluating distributed models. This approach is essential given the complexities of the earth system and the need for a comprehensive understanding of snow cover, frozen ground, and hydrometeorological data, particularly in regions where direct observations are scarce or difficult.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 遥感数据的集成结合数据同化，可以通过提供准确的强迫数据来改善高山水文模型的预测，验证遥感数据，并评估分布式模型。考虑到地球系统的复杂性以及对雪盖、冻土和水文气象数据的全面理解的需求，这种方法在直接观测稀缺或困难的地区尤为重要。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What are the primary causes for the scarcity of observation data in alpine regions, particularly for hydrological modeling?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 阿尔卑斯地区观测数据稀缺的主要原因是什么，特别是在水文建模方面？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The scarcity of observation data in alpine regions is primarily due to the difficulties of access, technological barriers, cold and harsh climate, high altitude, and complex topography. These factors hinder consistent data collection and the development of remote sensing technologies and hydrological models.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 阿尔卑斯地区观测数据稀缺的主要原因是获取困难、技术障碍、寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔以及复杂的地形。这些因素阻碍了数据的持续收集以及遥感技术和水文模型的发展。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What leads to the challenges in accurately estimating surface fluxes in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在强对流灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量面临的挑战是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The challenges in accurately estimating surface fluxes are primarily due to the uncertainty in the surface–air temperature difference, errors in determining soil and vegetation component temperatures from radiometric temperatures, and the strong advective environment. Image classification errors, atmospheric radiation factors, and uncertainties in radiation transmittances also contribute to the difficulties.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 准确估计表面通量的挑战主要源于表面与空气温度差的不确定性、从辐射温度确定土壤和植被组分温度的误差，以及强烈的平流环境。图像分类错误、大气辐射因素和辐射透过率的不确定性也增加了这些困难。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is the integration of remote sensing data with ground-based observations crucial for improving the predictive understanding of hydrological processes in alpine regions?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 将遥感数据与地面观测相结合，对于提高对高山地区水文过程的预测理解至关重要。
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The integration is crucial because it helps improve the prediction of hydrological processes by providing accurate forcing data, validating remote sensing data, and allowing the evaluation of models. Remote sensing data alone can have uncertainties, especially in complex alpine environments, and combining it with ground-based observations can enhance data accuracy and model validation.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 集成是至关重要的，因为它通过提供准确的强迫数据、验证遥感数据和允许模型评估来帮助改善水文过程的预测。仅依赖遥感数据可能存在不确定性，尤其是在复杂的高山环境中，将其与地面观测相结合可以提高数据的准确性和模型的验证。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential consequences of using high-resolution thermal cameras for measuring soil and canopy component temperatures in evapotranspiration models?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用高分辨率热像仪测量土壤和冠层组分温度在蒸散发模型中的潜在后果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Using high-resolution thermal cameras allows for accurate estimation of soil and canopy component temperatures, which improves the validation of evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration measurements with observed ratios using stable isotopes and eddy covariance systems. This approach enhances the separation of latent fluxes for soil and vegetation components, providing reliable estimates even in strongly advective environments.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用高分辨率热像仪可以准确估计土壤和冠层组分的温度，从而改善通过稳定同位素和涡度协方差系统观察比率来验证蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散发的测量。这种方法增强了土壤和植被组分潜在通量的分离，即使在强烈的平流环境中也能提供可靠的估计。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the outcomes of establishing an integrated, distributed, and multiscale observation network for studying hydrometeorological processes in alpine regions?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 建立一个集成的、分布式的和多尺度的观测网络来研究高山地区的水气象过程的结果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Establishing such a network results in the collection of comprehensive datasets that include long-term hydrometeorological, snow cover, and frozen ground data. This network provides accurate forcing data for hydrological modeling, validates remote sensing products, and supports the evaluation of distributed models, thereby advancing the understanding of hydrological processes and aiding in the development of next-generation ecosystem observation systems.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 建立这样的网络会收集全面的数据集，包括长期的水文气象、雪盖和冻土数据。该网络提供准确的水文模型强迫数据，验证遥感产品，并支持分布式模型的评估，从而推动对水文过程的理解，并有助于下一代生态系统观测系统的发展。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What are the specific methods used to measure soil temperature and moisture in a high-altitude alpine region, and how do these methods accommodate the challenging environmental conditions?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在高海拔高山地区，测量土壤温度和湿度的具体方法有哪些，这些方法如何适应恶劣的环境条件？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Soil temperature and moisture were measured within multiple layers using automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) and superstations. These observations were made in both permafrost and seasonally frozen ground zones to capture freeze-thaw processes. Challenges like high altitudes and complex topography are addressed by deploying a combination of seven AMSs and two superstations, which provide detailed data for hydrological modeling and remote sensing validation.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 土壤温度和湿度通过自动气象站（AMSs）和超级气象站进行多层次测量。这些观测在永久冻土和季节性冻土区域进行，以捕捉冻融过程。通过部署七个AMS和两个超级气象站来应对高海拔和复杂地形等挑战，从而为水文模型和遥感验证提供详细数据。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How is the collection of snow cover properties structured within an integrated observation network to ensure comprehensive data for hydrological modeling in alpine regions?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在综合观测网络中，雪盖特性的收集是如何结构化的，以确保为高山地区的水文建模提供全面的数据？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The collection of snow cover properties is structured around a snow observation superstation using advanced techniques and instruments. This includes automatic measurements of snow depth, snow water equivalent (SWE), and albedo. Blowing snow flux is also measured using specific instruments. The network's structure aims to provide accurate and effective forcing data for alpine hydrological models and validate remote sensing products.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 雪覆盖特性的收集围绕一个雪观测超级站进行，采用先进的技术和仪器。这包括对雪深、雪水当量（SWE）和反照率的自动测量。还使用特定仪器测量吹雪通量。该网络的结构旨在为高山水文模型提供准确有效的强迫数据，并验证遥感产品。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedural steps are involved in processing and ensuring the quality of meteorological data collected from high-altitude research stations, especially in terms of addressing data gaps and anomalies?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 处理和确保从高海拔研究站收集的气象数据质量所涉及的程序步骤，特别是在解决数据缺口和异常方面，主要包括以下几个步骤：
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The procedural steps include ensuring a consistent number of data points daily (144 per day at 10-minute intervals), marking missing data with a specific code, and addressing sensor malfunctions. Data quality control involves removing duplicate records, deleting data outside of physical or instrumental range, and marking questionable data. Consistent formatting for dates and times is also maintained to facilitate data processing and analysis.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 程序步骤包括确保每天有一致数量的数据点（每天144个，每10分钟一个间隔），用特定代码标记缺失数据，并处理传感器故障。数据质量控制涉及删除重复记录，删除超出物理或仪器范围的数据，以及标记可疑数据。同时，保持日期和时间的一致格式，以便于数据处理和分析。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What technological advancements and methodologies enable the integration of remote sensing data with ground-based observations to improve hydrological modeling in alpine regions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些技术进步和方法论使得遥感数据与地面观测的结合成为可能，从而改善高山地区的水文模型？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The integration of remote sensing data with ground-based observations is enabled by advancements in data assimilation techniques, state-of-the-art instrumentation at snow observation superstations, and the use of wireless sensor networks. These enable detailed monitoring of meteorological, snow cover, and frozen ground processes, facilitating more accurate hydrological modeling in alpine regions.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 遥感数据与地面观测的集成得益于数据同化技术的进步、雪观测超级站的先进仪器以及无线传感器网络的应用。这些技术使得对气象、雪盖和冻土过程的详细监测成为可能，从而促进了高山地区更准确的水文模型构建。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might there be challenges in collecting consistent data in alpine hydrological observations?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在阿尔卑斯地区的水文观测中，收集一致数据可能面临哪些挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Several formidable challenges, including the cold and harsh climate, high altitude, and complex topography, inhibit complete and consistent data collection. These factors hinder the development of remote sensing technologies and alpine hydrological models.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 几个严峻的挑战，包括寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形，阻碍了完整和一致的数据收集。这些因素妨碍了遥感技术和高山水文模型的发展。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why is it expected that integrating remote sensing with ground-based observations could improve hydrological predictions in alpine regions?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 预计将遥感技术与地面观测相结合可以改善高山地区的水文预测，原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Remote sensing data combined with data assimilation could improve the prediction of hydrological processes due to the scarcity of observation data in alpine regions. However, complexities in the earth system introduce uncertainties, necessitating validation and calibration of remote sensing data.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 遥感数据与数据同化相结合可以改善对水文过程的预测，因为在高山地区观测数据稀缺。然而，地球系统的复杂性引入了不确定性，因此需要对遥感数据进行验证和校准。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How effective are integrated observation networks in addressing the challenges of data scarcity in alpine regions?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 综合观测网络在应对阿尔卑斯地区数据稀缺挑战方面的有效性如何？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Integrated observation networks are crucial for addressing data scarcity in alpine regions due to the difficulties of access and technological barriers. They provide a comprehensive suite of datasets, including hydrometeorological, snow cover, and frozen ground data, which are essential for accurate hydrological modeling and understanding of eco-functions. Such networks help in validating remote sensing data and improving predictive models by offering continuous and high-quality data.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 综合观测网络对于解决高山地区数据稀缺问题至关重要，因为这些地区存在访问困难和技术障碍。它们提供了一套全面的数据集，包括水文气象、雪盖和冻土数据，这些数据对于准确的水文模型和生态功能的理解至关重要。这些网络有助于验证遥感数据，并通过提供连续和高质量的数据来改善预测模型。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What are the key challenges associated with collecting and validating remote sensing data in alpine hydrology?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在高山水文学中，收集和验证遥感数据的主要挑战有哪些？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The key challenges include the harsh climate, high altitude, and complex topography that inhibit consistent data collection. These factors introduce uncertainties in remote sensing data which need validation and calibration. Additionally, the scarcity of observation data and the influence of strong winds, which affect measurements like snow density, complicate the validation process of remote sensing technologies in alpine regions.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 主要挑战包括严酷的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形，这些因素阻碍了一致的数据收集。这些因素引入了遥感数据的不确定性，需要进行验证和校准。此外，观测数据的稀缺以及强风的影响（如雪密度的测量）使得在高山地区验证遥感技术的过程更加复杂。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how data on soil temperature and moisture is collected and validated in such remote alpine regions.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白在如此偏远的高山地区，土壤温度和湿度的数据是如何收集和验证的。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Data on soil temperature and moisture in remote alpine regions is collected using automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) and superstations designed for frozen ground observation. Soil temperature and moisture profiles are intensively measured in multiple layers, and wireless sensor networks (WSNs) with multiple nodes are established to capture seasonal changes, providing high-resolution data for validation and modeling.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 在偏远的高山地区，使用自动气象站（AMSs）和专为冻土观测设计的超级站收集土壤温度和湿度数据。土壤温度和湿度剖面在多个层次上进行密集测量，并建立了多个节点的无线传感器网络（WSNs）以捕捉季节变化，从而提供高分辨率的数据用于验证和建模。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm unsure about the challenges involved in collecting accurate snow cover data in high-altitude regions.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我对在高海拔地区收集准确的雪盖数据所面临的挑战感到不确定。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Challenges in collecting snow cover data in high-altitude regions include harsh climate conditions, technological barriers, and complex topography. Instruments like ultrasonic snow depth sensors and GammaMONitor for snow water equivalent (SWE) are used, but the data collection is often hindered by strong winds and power loss, which can lead to intermittent data loss and necessitate robust data validation and calibration processes.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 在高海拔地区收集雪盖数据的挑战包括恶劣的气候条件、技术障碍和复杂的地形。虽然使用超声波雪深传感器和GammaMONitor来测量雪水当量（SWE），但强风和电力损失常常会妨碍数据收集，这可能导致间歇性的数据丢失，并需要进行稳健的数据验证和校准过程。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore the data collection methods used for capturing hydrometeorological and soil data in alpine regions, focusing on the technological approaches and instruments employed.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探讨用于捕捉高山地区水文气象和土壤数据的数据收集方法，重点关注所采用的技术方法和仪器。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Data collection in alpine regions involves the use of an integrated, distributed, and multiscale observation network. This includes automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) for monitoring meteorological variables such as wind, air temperature, humidity, air pressure, four-component radiation, and precipitation. Soil temperature and moisture are measured within multiple layers, and evapotranspiration is observed using an eddy covariance system. Advanced techniques and instruments, such as a snow observation superstation and thermal infrared cameras, are used to capture snow and soil physics data, which are crucial for understanding freeze-thaw processes.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在阿尔卑斯地区的数据收集涉及使用一个集成的、分布式的和多尺度的观测网络。这包括自动气象站（AMS），用于监测气象变量，如风速、空气温度、湿度、气压、四组分辐射和降水。土壤温度和湿度在多个层次上进行测量，蒸散发则通过涡度协方差系统进行观察。先进的技术和仪器，如雪观测超级站和热红外相机，用于捕捉雪和土壤物理数据，这对于理解冻融过程至关重要。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please identify and analyze the challenges encountered in collecting data in remote and high-altitude areas, particularly those related to snow and frozen ground observations.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请识别和分析在偏远和高海拔地区收集数据时遇到的挑战，特别是与雪和冻土观测相关的挑战。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Challenges in collecting data in remote and high-altitude areas include harsh climate conditions, high altitude, and complex topography, which can lead to intermittent data loss due to power issues and sensor malfunctions. The scarcity of observation data is compounded by difficulties in access and technological barriers, making it challenging to develop remote sensing technologies and alpine hydrological models. Additionally, strong winds can affect the accuracy of snow density measurements, which are derived from snow depth and snow water equivalent data.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在偏远和高海拔地区收集数据的挑战包括恶劣的气候条件、高海拔和复杂的地形，这可能导致由于电力问题和传感器故障而间歇性的数据丢失。观测数据的稀缺加上获取困难和技术障碍，使得开发遥感技术和高山水文模型变得具有挑战性。此外，强风可能会影响雪密度测量的准确性，而雪密度是通过雪深和雪水当量数据得出的。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please investigate the potential datasets and observation networks available for studying hydrological processes in alpine regions, highlighting their scope and significance.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请调查可用于研究高山地区水文过程的潜在数据集和观测网络，强调它们的范围和重要性。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Potential datasets for studying hydrological processes in alpine regions are collected from an integrated alpine hydrology observation network in the upper reaches of the Heihe River Basin (HRB). This network consists of automatic meteorological stations, a snow superstation, and a frozen ground superstation, providing comprehensive datasets on hydrometeorology, snow, and frozen ground processes. These datasets are essential for validating remote sensing products, improving hydrological models, and understanding the impact of climate change and human activities on alpine hydrology. The datasets are open-access and serve as a testing platform for scientists from various disciplines.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 潜在的用于研究高山地区水文过程的数据集来自于黑河流域上游的综合高山水文观测网络。该网络由自动气象站、雪超级站和冻土超级站组成，提供了关于水文气象、雪和冻土过程的综合数据集。这些数据集对于验证遥感产品、改进水文模型以及理解气候变化和人类活动对高山水文的影响至关重要。这些数据集是开放获取的，为来自不同学科的科学家提供了一个测试平台。
